citation.article-title: Proposal of the genus Thermoactinomyces sensu stricto and three new genera, Laceyella, Thermoflavimicrobium and Seinonella, on the basis of phenotypic, phylogenetic and chemotaxonomic analyses
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Laceyella (La.cey.el′la. N.L. dim. fem. n. Laceyella named to honour Dr John Lacey, an English microbiologist, for his contribution to the taxonomy of the genus Thermoactinomyces and actinomycetes).
Cells are aerobic, Gram-positive, non-acid-fast and chemo-organotrophic.
Aerial and substrate mycelia are formed.
Yellow–brown or greyish-yellow soluble pigment may be produced.
Sessile endospores may be produced on sporophores.
The cell-wall peptidoglycan contains meso-DAP but no characteristic sugars.
Additional characters found in this study are as follows.
Major fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0 and anteiso-C15 : 0.
DNA G+C content of the type strains of two species is 48–49 mol% (determined by HPLC in this study).
The type species is Laceyella sacchari (Lacey 1971).
